title: Nathan Freer
text:
Nathan Freer (born 21 May 1989), also known by the <a href="nickname">nickname</a> of "IRONWOLF", is a former professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 2000s and 2010s. He played at club level for the <a href="Norland%20Sharks%20A.R.L.F.C.">Norland Sharks</a> <a href="Norland%20Sharks%20ARLFC">ARLFC</a> (in <a href="Hessle">Hessle</a>, <a href="East%20Riding%20of%20Yorkshire">East Riding of Yorkshire</a>, of the <a href="Yorkshire%20Men%27s%20League">Yorkshire Men's League</a>), <a href="Hull%20F.C.">Hull F.C.</a> (<a href="List%20of%20Hull%20F.C.%20players">Heritage №</a>), <a href="Doncaster%20R.L.F.C.">Doncaster</a> (Heritage № 981) (<a href="Loan%20%28sports%29">loan</a>), the <a href="York%20City%20Knights">York City Knights</a> (two spells) and the <a href="Featherstone%20Rovers">Featherstone Rovers</a> (<a href="List%20of%20Featherstone%20Rovers%20players">Heritage № 962</a>), as a , and as of 2016, he is the Head of Strength and Conditioning at the City Of Hull Academy.
Playing career.
Freer progressed through the Hull F.C. Academy ranks. An imposing figure on the field he has a fiery reputation. Nathan Freer won promotion from <a href="League%201%20%28rugby%20league%29">National League Two</a> to <a href="Championship%20%28rugby%20league%29">National League One</a> with <a href="Doncaster%20R.L.F.C.">Doncaster</a> during 2008, he won promotion from <a href="League%201%20%28rugby%20league%29">Championship 1</a> to <a href="Championship%20%28rugby%20league%29">Championship</a> with <a href="York%20City%20Knights">York City Knights</a> during 2010, he made his début for the <a href="Featherstone%20Rovers">Featherstone Rovers</a> on Wednesday 15 February 2012, and he played his last match for the Featherstone Rovers during 2012. He returned to York City Knights where they were looking for promotion back into the Championship.
